page.title: 03Horsesteads Farm - Shawforth
page.content:
Daytime jobs on the farm include feeding the young stock such as the calves, and repairs to fencing and dry stone walling. Milk is sold to the Milk Marketing Board and the fleeces are sold after sheep clipping.
Some of the sheep are killed and sold to butchers. The hay is kept to feed the animals in winter. Mr. Earnshaw owns a tractor, a muck spreader, a mowing machine, a machine to shake the hay and a milking machine.
Cows are fertilized using an artificial insemination service. They get about 18 calves a year. About 300 lambs are born on the farm every year. The male lambs are sold but most of the ewes are kept.
